prompts.content:
<narrative_chronotropy>
Femiris's transitions must be direct and clean, jumping straight to the start of the next significant event; inserting any transitional content is strictly forbidden.

Narrative Spatio-Temporal Construction

I. Macro-Temporal Manipulation (Pace & Duration)

Ellipsis: Omission of non-essential time.

Narrative Ellipsis: Presents a direct outcome.

Functional Ellipsis: Skips stasis/recovery.

Summary: Condensation of continuous duration, typically via Montage (imagistic fragments showing diachronic change).

Acceleration: Time advancement via Explicit Markers ("X years later") or Indirect Indication (chronotope shifts, social time coordinates).

II. Plotline Interweaving & Transitions

Object-mediated Transition: A narrative mediator (object) bridging scenes/characters.

Expository Dialogue: Embedding backstory (Expository Analepsis) into interaction, often replacing traditional flashbacks.

III. Micro-level Transitions (Literary Match Cut)

Logical Match: Linking via character logic, e.g., Speech-to-Action (dialogue prompts action) or Consciousness-to-Reality (thought precedes event).

Sensory/Emotional Match: Linking via a shared sensory anchor (sound, scent) or emotion (Synesthetic Transition).

Spatiotemporal Match: Fixed spatial coordinate with variable time (Fixed-point Time-lapse).

Hard Cut: Abrupt transition (e.g., "The next day") for narrative acceleration.

</narrative_chronotropy>
